meanings.definition: A passage or segment taken from a larger work.
meanings.sent1: The teacher read an excerpt from the book to the class.
meanings.sent2: I found an interesting excerpt in the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The excerpt from the play made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like an excerpt from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The excerpt painted a vivid picture of the setting.

meanings.definition: To select and use a passage from a larger work.
meanings.sent1: She will excerpt a paragraph for her presentation.
meanings.sent2: I need to excerpt some quotes for my essay.
meanings.sent3: He likes to excerpt the most exciting parts of the story.
meanings.sent4: Excerpting the key points will make your summary clearer.
meanings.sent5: Remember to excerpt only the relevant information.
